page.title: 08NATURAL HISTORY
page.content: The area contains no nature reserves or Sites of Special Scientific Interest. Most of the land is used for intensive cereal production, and any grassland is ley. There are a few small remnants of chalk grassland to be found on Windmill Hill, adjacent to the Clothall Road. There are some ancient hedgerow in the area around Clothall and one hedgerow bordering the line of a Roman road contains 12 species in a 30m length. Weston Woods, on the escarpment to the SE of Baldock consists of mature Beech trees, with a ground cover of Bluebells. Part of the area of Weston woods is regenerating hawthorn scrub. The area outside Baldock is clasified as of great landscape value.
